pull.title: [REST] add /rest/chaininfos
pull.body: With this call is basically possible to create a little blockexplorer like web interface.

events.body:
It seems more logical to have a /rest/chaininfo.json which returns a JSON object containing best block hash, and is expandable to more useful info in the future.

Basically 'getblockchaininfo' exported via REST, in other words.

ChainInfos makes more sense.
Changes the PR to support getchaininfos.
Looks mostly OK at first glance.  Only nit is including unrelated cleanups in the same commit.
Okay. Fixed the smuggled cleanups. Added docs update.
ut ACK, though interested in comments from others.

issue.title: Use `old_rpc()` for all RPC calls
issue.body:
`old_rpc()` uses `requests` and is thread safe.
In the code of `python-bitcoinlib` rpc module, I don't see any reason to use it.
The only important thing IMHO is to deserialise transactions with `python-bitcoinlib`, like is done here: https://github.com/petertodd/python-bitcoinlib/blob/master/bitcoin/rpc.py#L313.
But we are already doing that with `old_rpc()` in the most important place: https://github.com/CounterpartyXCP/counterpartyd/blob/master/lib/blocks.py#L482.
